summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of a Material Handler at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding his activities and observations on August 9, 2019, the night Jeffrey Epstein died. The interviewee describes his shift, overtime duties in the Special Housing Unit (SHU), and interactions with other officers, providing details about the timeline and procedures around the time of Epstein's death.

persons.name: Omer Ramey
persons.context: Interviewed regarding his activities on August 9, 2019, the night of Jeffrey Epstein's death. He worked his normal 8am-4pm shift and overtime in the SHU, assisting with commissary and food delivery.

persons.name: Donaleski
persons.context: Present for the interview and advised that the standard proffer agreement from the first interview applied to this interview as well.

persons.name: NOEL
persons.context: An officer working in the SHU with the interviewee on August 9, 2019. The interviewee helped NOEL with the feed (food delivery) and stated NOEL would have had to be at the grill of each tier for commissary distribution.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate in the SHU's L-Tier. The document details the delivery of food to him and observations of his cell on the night of his death.

connections.description: Worked together in the SHU on August 9, 2019. Ramey helped NOEL with the food feed and commissary distribution.
Ramey delivered food to inmate Epstein's cell on L-Tier on the night of August 9, 2019.
NOEL was an officer on duty in the SHU where Epstein was housed. Procedures required NOEL to be at the grill for tier access.

events.title: Epstein's Final Day and Death
events.description: The day Jeffrey Epstein died in the MCC SHU. The document details the timeline of staff shifts, commissary distribution, food delivery, and cell checks leading up to the discovery of his death.

events.title: FBI Interview of MCC Staff
events.description: FBI, OIG, and AUSA personnel interview Material Handler Omer Ramey regarding his activities and observations on August 9, 2019, at the MCC.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, New York
United States Attorneys Office (USAO), Southern District of New York (SDNY), 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, New York
keyFacts: Material Handler Omer Ramey worked overtime in the MCC SHU on the night of August 9, 2019, assisting with food delivery and commissary.
Ramey stated he spent no more than 60 seconds on L-Tier when delivering food to Jeffrey Epstein that night.
Ramey indicated that Officer NOEL would have had to be at the grill of each tier for anyone to go down range to do commissary, implying controlled access.
The interview reveals potential policy violations, noting it is against MCC policy for an officer to go down tiers alone without another officer assisting.
Ramey was relieved from his shift at approximately 11:50 PM on August 9, 2019.
